Monitoring: Alerts 2. Admin perspective - Alerting > Alerting Details page > Alerting Rule > Metrics
testcase.classname: 2. Admin perspective - Alerting > Alerting Details page > Alerting Rule > Metrics

testcase.name: Monitoring: Alerts 3. Admin perspective - Creates and expires a Silence
testcase.classname: 3. Admin perspective - Creates and expires a Silence

failure.message:
Timed out retrying after 60000ms: `cy.type()` failed because the page updated while this command was executing. Cypress tried to locate elements based on this query:
> <input>
We initially found matching element(s), but while waiting for them to become actionable, they disappeared from the page. Common situations why this happens: - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element
You can typically solve this by breaking up a chain. For example, rewrite:
> `cy.get('button').click().click()`
to
> `cy.get('button').as('btn').click()` > `cy.get('@btn').click()`
https://on.cypress.io/element-has-detached-from-dom

testcase.failure:
CypressError: Timed out retrying after 60000ms: `cy.type()` failed because the page updated while this command was executing. Cypress tried to locate elements based on this query:
> <input>
We initially found matching element(s), but while waiting for them to become actionable, they disappeared from the page. Common situations why this happens: - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element
You can typically solve this by breaking up a chain. For example, rewrite:
> `cy.get('button').click().click()`
to
> `cy.get('button').as('btn').click()` > `cy.get('@btn').click()`
